title: Police investigating after piece of a pig turns up in Newton park
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Newton police investigate pig leg or flank found in Auburndale Park with a red flag and note.
Authorities uncertain if pig meat was to feed wildlife, lure animals for hunting, or for another reason.
Hunting on conservation land in Massachusetts is prohibited under General Law Chapter 131, Section 59.

title: Jaylen Brown, Payton Pritchard dominate in blowout win over Lakers: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored a game-high 32 points on 10-for-28 shooting, contributing to the Celtics' 111-89 win over the Lakers.
Payton Pritchard excelled off the bench, scoring 30 points, continuing his impressive performance as the Celtics won six of seven games.
LeBron James praised Jaylen Brown after the game, dismissing previous comments about his son Bronny, indicating a respectful relationship.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Monday, Feb. 23
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A major snowstorm causes closures of dozens of Massachusetts school districts on Monday, Feb. 23, 2026.
Boston and surrounding areas, including Worcester and Cambridge, are among the numerous districts closed due to the storm.
Residents can email [email protected] with school closure updates to ensure accurate information.

title: Fall River police searching for man accused of shooting, killing dog
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Fall River police are searching for Kyron Simmons, 36, accused of shooting and killing a dog on Feb. 3.
Simmons faces charges including home invasion and carrying a loaded firearm without a license, police reported.
A search of Simmons's residence revealed firearm accessories; an arrest warrant has been issued for him.

title: Greater Boston town issues guidance after bobcat sighting
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dedham Animal Control reported a bobcat sighting near Deerpath Road and Route 109 in Dedham, Greater Boston.
Residents were advised to follow safety practices, like eliminating outdoor food sources and supervising pets.
Bobcat activity, similar to other wildlife, increases during mating season, prompting more local sightings.

title: Alex Cora gives an early preview of Red Sox 2026 lineup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Cora shared Boston Red Sox's potential 2026 Opening Day lineup with Roman Anthony and Trevor Story leading.
Roman Anthony is projected to be the leadoff hitter; he batted .336 with six home runs in his last 32 games in 2025.
Isiah Kiner-Falefa, not top prospect Marcelo Mayer, is expected to start at second base, highlighting roster competition.

title: Live updates: What to know about the nor’easter hitting Massachusetts
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Governor Maura Healey urges residents to stay off roads as Massachusetts faces up to 2 feet of snow.
Boston declares a snow emergency; schools and city buildings closed, and parking ban initiated Sunday.
MBTA operates on emergency schedules with reduced services; DoorDash and Grubhub suspend deliveries.

title: Bruins react to McAvoy, Swayman’s gold-medal win over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman from the Boston Bruins won gold with Team USA at the Milan Olympics.
McAvoy played a key role in the tournament, logging significant ice time and making crucial defensive plays.
Bruins teammates celebrated their victory at Warrior Ice Arena despite the absence of the gold-winning players.

title: 2026 NFL Mock Draft roundup: 7 names for Patriots fans to know entering combine week
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots hold the No. 31 pick in the 2026 NFL Draft.
Draft experts predict the Patriots will select either an offensive lineman or edge rusher.
Potential draft picks for the Patriots include Kenyon Sadiq, Zion Young, and Max Iheanachor.

title: Team USA writes a new chapter and other takeaways from gold-medal triumph over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA men's ice hockey wins first Olympic gold medal since 1980, defeating Canada 2-1 in overtime.
Jack Hughes scores the winning goal; Connor Hellebuyck makes 41 saves in a standout performance.
The 2026 Olympic gold marks the U.S.'s third in men's hockey, following victories in 1960 and 1980.
